sentences: Melvin Sparks (March 22, 1946 â€“ March 15, 2011) was an American soul jazz, hard bop and jazz blues guitarist.
Sparks was born in Houston, Texas, United States, and raised in a musical family.

Sparks began working in the rhythm and blues genre as a high school student, first with Hank Ballard and the Midnighters, and then with the Upsetters, a touring band formed by Little Richard, which also backed Jackie Wilson, Curtis Mayfield and Marvin Gaye.
Sparks moved to New York City and worked as a session musician for Blue Note and Prestige Records.
As part of the burgeoning soul-jazz scene of the late 1960s and early 1970s, Sparks often backed organists like Jack McDuff, Dr. Lonnie Smith, Charles Earland and Leon Spencer.
Sparks released his debut album, Sparks!, for Prestige in 1970.
Sparks died on March 15, 2011, at age 64, at his home in Mount Vernon, New York.
